00034 #include <net-snmp/net-snmp-config.h>

00039 
00040 #if !HAVE_STRTOL
00041 
00042 #if HAVE_LIMITS_H
00043 #include <limits.h>
00044 #endif
00045 #include <ctype.h>
00046 #include <errno.h>
00047 #if HAVE_STDLIB_H
00048 #include <stdlib.h>
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 /*
00052  * Convert a string to a long integer.
00053  *
00054  * Ignores `locale' stuff.  Assumes that the upper and lower case
00055  * alphabets and digits are each contiguous.
00056  */
00057 long
00058 strtol(const char *nptr, char **endptr, int base)
00059 {
00060     const char     *s = nptr;
00061     unsigned long   acc;
00062     int             c;
00063     unsigned long   cutoff;
00064     int             neg = 0, any, cutlim;
00065 
00066     /*
00067      * Skip white space and pick up leading +/- sign if any. If base is 0,
00068      * allow 0x for hex and 0 for octal, else assume decimal; if base is
00069      * already 16, allow 0x.
00070      */
00071     do {
00072         c = *s++;
00073     } while (isspace(c));
00074     if (c == '-') {
00075         neg = 1;
00076         c = *s++;
00077     } else if (c == '+')
00078         c = *s++;
00079     if ((base == 0 || base == 16) && c == '0' && (*s == 'x' || *s == 'X')) {
00080         c = s[1];
00081         s += 2;
00082         base = 16;
00083     }
00084     if (base == 0)
00085         base = c == '0' ? 8 : 10;
00086 
00087     /*
00088      * Compute the cutoff value between legal numbers and illegal numbers.
00089      * That is the largest legal value, divided by the base.  An input
00090      * number that is greater than this value, if followed by a legal
00091      * input character, is too big.  One that is equal to this value may
00092      * be valid or not; the limit between valid and invalid numbers is
00093      * then based on the last digit.  For instance, if the range for longs
00094      * is [-2147483648..2147483647] and the input base is 10, cutoff will
00095      * be set to 214748364 and cutlim to either 7 (neg==0) or 8 (neg==1),
00096      * meaning that if we have accumulated a value > 214748364, or equal
00097      * but the next digit is > 7 (or 8), the number is too big, and we
00098      * will return a range error.
00099      *
00100      * Set any if any `digits' consumed; make it negative to indicate
00101      * overflow.
00102      */
00103     cutoff = neg ? -(unsigned long) LONG_MIN : LONG_MAX;
00104     cutlim = cutoff % (unsigned long) base;
00105     cutoff /= (unsigned long) base;
00106     for (acc = 0, any = 0;; c = *s++) {
00107         if (isdigit(c))
00108             c -= '0';
00109         else if (isalpha(c))
00110             c -= isupper(c) ? 'A' - 10 : 'a' - 10;
00111         else
00112             break;
00113         if (c >= base)
00114             break;
00115         if (any < 0 || acc > cutoff || acc == cutoff && c > cutlim)
00116             any = -1;
00117         else {
00118             any = 1;
00119             acc *= base;
00120             acc += c;
00121         }
00122     }
00123     if (any < 0) {
00124         acc = neg ? LONG_MIN : LONG_MAX;
00125         errno = ERANGE;
00126     } else if (neg)
00127         acc = -acc;
00128     if (endptr != 0)
00129         *endptr = any ? s - 1 : (char *) nptr;
00130     return (acc);
00131 }
00132 
00133 #endif                          /* !HAVE_STRTOL */
